questions.question: Evaluate the definite integral \(\int_0^3 \dfrac{x}{\sqrt{x^2+16}}\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_0^{\pi/2}\cos^2 x\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_3^{3e^4}\dfrac{2}{x}\,dx\).
A particle moves along the x‑axis with velocity \(v(t)=t^2-6t+8\) m/s. On the interval \([0,6]\), how many times does the particle change direction?
questions.explanation: Set \(v(t)=0\): \((t-2)(t-4)=0\) ⇒ \(t=2\) and \(t=4\). Check signs: \(v(0)=8>0\), \(v(3)=9-18+8=-1<0\), \(v(5)=25-30+8=3>0\). The velocity changes sign at both \(t=2\) and \(t=4\), so the particle changes direction 2 times.

questions.question: Find the average value of \(f(x)=3x^2\) on the interval \([0,3]\).
Let \(f(x)=x^3-2x-5\). Which of the following correctly applies the Intermediate Value Theorem to guarantee a zero on the given interval?
questions.explanation: IVT requires a sign change. \(f(2)=8-4-5=-1<0\) and \(f(3)=27-6-5=16>0\). Since \(f\) is continuous and changes sign on \([2,3]\), there is a zero there. The other intervals have the same sign at both endpoints.

questions.question: Find the general solution to the differential equation \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=-2xy\).
Let \(M(x)=\int_{x^2}^{3}\sqrt{1+t^3}\,dt\). Find \(M'(x)\).
questions.explanation: The lower limit is the variable expression. Rewrite as \(M(x)=-\int_3^{x^2}\sqrt{1+t^3}\,dt\). By FTC and the chain rule: \(M'(x)=-\sqrt{1+(x^2)^3}\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x^2)=-\sqrt{1+x^6}\cdot2x=-2x\sqrt{1+x^6}\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=\ln(\sin x)\).
questions.explanation: Chain rule: \(f'(x)=\frac{1}{\sin x}\cdot\cos x=\frac{\cos x}{\sin x}=\cot x\).

questions.question: Find \(f'(x)\) if \(f(x)=\sec^2 x\).
questions.explanation: Write \(f(x)=(\sec x)^2\). Chain rule: \(f'(x)=2\sec x\cdot\sec x\tan x=2\sec^2 x\tan x\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x^2-3 & x<2\\kx-1 & x\ge2\end{cases}\). What value of \(k\) makes \(f\) continuous at \(x=2\)?
Find all x‑values where \(f(x)=x^4-24x^2\) has a point of inflection.
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=4x^3-48x\), \(f''(x)=12x^2-48=12(x^2-4)=12(x-2)(x+2)\). Set \(f''=0\): \(x=\pm2\). Since \(f''\) changes sign at both values (positive outside, negative between), both are inflection points.

questions.question: Use implicit differentiation to find \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}\) for \(\cos(x+y)=y\).
questions.explanation: Differentiate both sides: \(-\sin(x+y)\cdot(1+y')=y'\). Expand: \(-\sin(x+y)-\sin(x+y)\cdot y'=y'\). Collect: \(-\sin(x+y)=y'+y'\sin(x+y)=y'(1+\sin(x+y))\). So \(y'=-\frac{\sin(x+y)}{1+\sin(x+y)}\).

questions.question: Find the equation of the normal line to \(y=x^2-4\) at the point \((3,5)\).
questions.explanation: \(y'=2x\). At \(x=3\): tangent slope \(=6\). Normal slope \(=-\frac{1}{6}\). Equation: \(y-5=-\frac{1}{6}(x-3)\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=x^2\sin x\). Find the instantaneous rate of change of \(f\) at \(x=\pi\).
If \(f(2)=5\) and \(f(9)=19\), find \(\int_2^9 f'(x)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus: \(\int_2^9 f'(x)\,dx=f(9)-f(2)=19-5=14\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=x^3+x\) on \([0,2]\), find the value of \(c\) in \((0,2)\) guaranteed by the Mean Value Theorem.
Differentiate \(f(x)=x^2\cos x\).
questions.explanation: Product rule: \(f'(x)=(2x)(\cos x)+(x^2)(-\sin x)=2x\cos x-x^2\sin x\).

questions.question: A particle has velocity \(v(t)=t^3-12t\) ft/s on \([0,4]\). Find the minimum value of the velocity on this interval.
Determine the intervals on which \(f(x)=x^3-9x^2+24x-10\) is decreasing.
Which of the following functions is NOT differentiable at \(x=1\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(x)=|x-1|\) has a corner at \(x=1\): the left derivative is \(-1\) and the right derivative is \(+1\). Since they differ, \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=1\). The other three functions are smooth polynomials or exponentials, differentiable everywhere.

questions.question: A town's population grows at a rate of \(r(t)=50e^{0.02t}\) people per year. How many people are added in the first 10 years?

The derivative \(f'(x)\) equals zero at \(x=-3\) with positive values on both sides; changes from positive to negative at \(x=1\); and changes from negative to positive at \(x=5\). Classify each critical point.
options: Neither at \(-3\), max at \(1\), min at \(5\)
Max at \(-3\), max at \(1\), min at \(5\)
Neither at \(-3\), min at \(1\), max at \(5\)
Min at \(-3\), max at \(1\), min at \(5\)
questions.explanation: First Derivative Test: positive on both sides of \(x=-3\) ⇒ no sign change ⇒ neither. Positive to negative at \(x=1\) ⇒ relative maximum. Negative to positive at \(x=5\) ⇒ relative minimum.

questions.question: Find the area under the curve \(y=\sin x\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=\pi\).
At \(x=a\), a function satisfies \(f(a)>0\), \(f'(a)>0\), and \(f''(a)=0\) where \(f''\) changes sign. What can be concluded?
options: \(f\) has an inflection point above the x‑axis where \(f\) is increasing
\(f\) has a local maximum above the x‑axis
\(f\) has a local minimum above the x‑axis
questions.explanation: \(f(a)>0\) means above the x‑axis; \(f'(a)>0\) means increasing; \(f''(a)=0\) with a sign change means \(x=a\) is an inflection point (change in concavity). All three conditions together describe an inflection point above the x‑axis on an increasing portion.

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_{-2}^{2}(x^3+5)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: The function \(x^3\) is odd, so \(\int_{-2}^2 x^3\,dx=0\). The constant term gives \(\int_{-2}^2 5\,dx=5(4)=20\). Total \(=0+20=20\).

questions.question: Find the area of the region enclosed by \(y=3x\) and \(y=x^2\).
For \(f(x)=e^{-x^2}\), the second derivative is \(f''(x)=2e^{-x^2}(2x^2-1)\). On which interval is \(f\) concave down?
Find the equation of the tangent line to \(f(x)=\sqrt{x+5}\) at \(x=4\).
The radius of a spherical balloon is increasing. When the radius is 5 cm, the volume is increasing at 2 cm³/s. How fast is the radius increasing at that moment?
questions.explanation: \(V=\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\), so \(\frac{dV}{dt}=4\pi r^2\frac{dr}{dt}\). When \(r=5\) and \(\frac{dV}{dt}=2\): \(2=4\pi(25)\frac{dr}{dt}=100\pi\frac{dr}{dt}\) ⇒ \(\frac{dr}{dt}=\frac{1}{50\pi}\) cm/s.

questions.question: A radioactive substance has a half-life of 5 years. How long does it take to decay to \(\frac{1}{8}\) of its original amount?
questions.explanation: After each half-life, the amount is halved. \(\frac{1}{8}=\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)^3\), so 3 half-lives are needed. Time \(=3\times5=15\) years.

questions.question: Find all relative extrema of \(f(x)=(x-2)^2(x+1)\) using the First Derivative Test.
options: Relative maximum at \(x=0\) (\(f=4\)); relative minimum at \(x=2\) (\(f=0\))
Relative minimum at \(x=0\); relative maximum at \(x=2\)
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=2(x-2)(x+1)+(x-2)^2=(x-2)[2(x+1)+(x-2)]=(x-2)(3x)=3x(x-2)\). Critical: \(x=0,2\). Sign: positive for \(x<0\), negative for \(0<x<2\), positive for \(x>2\). So: relative max at \(x=0\) (\(f(0)=4\)), relative min at \(x=2\) (\(f(2)=0\)).

questions.question: The function \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x^2-2 & x<3\\k(x-3)+7 & x\ge3\end{cases}\) is differentiable at \(x=3\). Find \(k\).
questions.explanation: Continuity check: \(f(3^-)=9-2=7\) and \(f(3^+)=k(0)+7=7\) ✓ (automatic). Differentiability: left derivative \(=2x\big|_3=6\); right derivative \(=k\). Set equal: \(k=6\).

questions.question: Use the Trapezoidal Rule with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^1 e^x\,dx\).
Find the critical points of \(f(x)=\sin x\cos x\) on \([0,\pi]\).
The region bounded by \(y=2x\) and \(y=0\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=3\) is rotated about the x‑axis. Find the volume.
At what point on \(y=\dfrac{x^2}{2}\) is the tangent line perpendicular to \(y=-2x+3\)?
questions.explanation: Slope of given line \(=-2\). Perpendicular slope \(=\frac{1}{2}\). Set \(y'=x=\frac{1}{2}\). At \(x=\frac{1}{2}\): \(y=\frac{(1/2)^2}{2}=\frac{1}{8}\). Point: \(\left(\frac{1}{2},\frac{1}{8}\right)\).

questions.question: Consider \(f(x)=\begin{cases}\sin x & x<\pi\\x-\pi & x\ge\pi\end{cases}\). Is \(f\) differentiable at \(x=\pi\)?
options: No; \(f\) is continuous at \(x=\pi\) but the left derivative is \(-1\) and the right derivative is \(1\)
Yes; the derivatives of both pieces equal 1 at \(x=\pi\)
questions.explanation: Continuity: \(f(\pi^-)=\sin\pi=0\) and \(f(\pi^+)=\pi-\pi=0\) ✓. Left derivative: \(\cos\pi=-1\). Right derivative: \(1\). Since \(-1\ne1\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=\pi\).

questions.question: Let \(N(x)=\int_0^{x^3}e^{-t^2}\,dt\). Find \(N'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC and the chain rule: \(N'(x)=e^{-(x^3)^2}\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x^3)=e^{-x^6}\cdot3x^2=3x^2e^{-x^6}\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\displaystyle\lim_{x\to0}\frac{x-\sin x}{x^3}\).
questions.explanation: Form \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply L'Hôpital: \(\frac{1-\cos x}{3x^2}\). Still \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply again: \(\frac{\sin x}{6x}\). Still \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply again: \(\frac{\cos x}{6}\to\frac{1}{6}\). Alternatively, \(\sin x=x-\frac{x^3}{6}+\cdots\), so numerator \(\sim\frac{x^3}{6}\), giving limit \(\frac{1}{6}\).

questions.question: A farmer has 200 m of fencing to enclose a rectangular field against a straight barn wall (so only 3 sides need fencing). Find the dimensions and maximum area.
options: Width \(100\) m, depth \(50\) m; max area \(5000\) m²
Width \(50\) m, depth \(75\) m; max area \(3750\) m²
Width \(100\) m, depth \(100\) m; max area \(10000\) m²
Width \(67\) m, depth \(67\) m; max area \(4489\) m²
questions.explanation: Let \(x\) = width (parallel to barn), \(y\) = depth. Constraint: \(x+2y=200\) ⇒ \(x=200-2y\). Area \(A=xy=(200-2y)y=200y-2y^2\). \(\frac{dA}{dy}=200-4y=0\) ⇒ \(y=50\), \(x=100\). Max area \(=100\times50=5000\) m².

questions.question: Use the Second Derivative Test to classify the critical point(s) of \(f(x)=xe^{-x}\).
Use a right Riemann sum with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_1^5\dfrac{1}{x}\,dx\).
Find \(\dfrac{d}{dx}\left[\arcsin\!\left(\sqrt{x}\right)\right]\).
A particle has position \(s(t)=\sin(2t)+t\). Find the acceleration when the velocity is first zero for \(t>0\).
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of \(f(x)=2\sin x\) on \([0,\frac{3\pi}{2}]\).
options: Absolute max \(2\) at \(x=\dfrac{\pi}{2}\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=\dfrac{3\pi}{2}\)
Absolute max \(2\) at \(x=\dfrac{\pi}{2}\); absolute min \(0\) at \(x=0\)
Absolute max \(2\sqrt{2}\) at \(x=\dfrac{\pi}{4}\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=\dfrac{3\pi}{2}\)
Absolute max \(2\) at \(x=\pi\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=\dfrac{3\pi}{2}\)

questions.question: Solve the initial value problem \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=e^x y^2\), \(y(0)=1\).
A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=2t-6\) ft/s on \([0,5]\). Find both the displacement and the total distance traveled.
Differentiate \(f(x)=\cos^3(2x)\).
Use linear approximation at \(x=27\) to estimate \(\sqrt[3]{28}\).
